title: Rob Moodie (doctor)
text:
Rob Moodie (born 1953, c. <a href="Melbourne">Melbourne</a>) is the Professor of Global Health at the Nossal Institute of Global Health at the <a href="University%20of%20Melbourne">University of Melbourne</a> and was named <a href="Victorian%20Father%20of%20the%20Year">Victorian Father of the Year</a> in 2005. He is married and has two children.
He graduated in <a href="medicine">medicine</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Melbourne">University of Melbourne</a> in 1976, and has also studied <a href="Tropical%20Medicine">Tropical Medicine</a> at <a href="Paris%20University">Paris University</a> and <a href="Public%20health">Public Health</a> at <a href="Harvard%20University">Harvard University</a>. He has worked for the <a href="Save%20the%20Children%20Fund">Save the Children Fund</a>, <a href="M%C3%A9decins%20Sans%20Fronti%C3%A8res">Médecins Sans Frontières</a>, the <a href="Burnet%20Institute">Burnet Institute</a>, the <a href="World%20Health%20Organization">World Health Organization</a> and <a href="UNAIDS">UNAIDS</a>. He was <a href="CEO">CEO</a> of the Victorian Health Promotion Foundation (<a href="VicHealth">VicHealth</a>) from 1998 to 2007.
He was chair of the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> club from 2006 to 2010, and writes a regular column in "<a href="Cosmos%20%28magazine%29">Cosmos</a>" magazine on medical oddities.
